The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

Written by Tanya Collins · Published Dec 7, 2016 · Filed under Historical

Every day until Christmas Eve, a member of Suffolk Libraries staff will reveal a book, CD or DVD they will be giving as a Christmas present, and why. Today, library and information advisor Tanya Collins recommends The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

I just love this book. It gripped me from the first sentence and didnâ€™t let go until long after Iâ€™d finished it, if at all. Narrated by death, a brilliant concept, it tells of Liesel, a young girl living with her foster family in Nazi Germany. Clever, enthralling and soul-stirring, Zusak beautifully tells this story highlighting the importance of words and books. I left it a long time before I borrowed the film from the library, which although good, is of course not a patch on the book! If there could be only one book on my shelf (what a horrible thought!) this would be it.

This is one of our advent calendar suggestions for 2016. See the whole calendar →

Tanya Collins

I'm a library and information advisor.
